intro: Squamellaria tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered squamellaria, is a small, evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
